Key Match Events: Sacramento Kings dominated the Golden State Warriors to get an easy 129-99 win.
The Kings built as much as a 25-point lead at halftime.
The lead reached 36 points at some point in the fourth quarter.
Pre-Game Insights: The duel between Steph Curry and De'Aaron Fox was highlighted, but Fox was ruled out with an injury.
Post-Match Reflections: Sacramento improved to 17-19 for the season and have now won four games in a row.
The Warriors are now 18-17 with one more home game before going on a four-city road trip.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Kings' star guard De'Aaron Fox was ruled out with an injury, and Malik Monk was tasked with taking over.
The Warriors have been linked to a potential trade for Chicago Bulls center Nikola Vucevic.
Others: The game was played at the Chase Center, and the Kings' Domantas Sabonis dominated with eight points and eight rebounds in the first quarter.
